Create Command Execution Helper (internal/cmdutil package)
description:
**High Priority - Item 1 from Code Review**

There are 26+ instances of this pattern throughout the codebase:

```go
cmd := exec.Command("git", ...)
cmd.Dir = "/path"
if err := cmd.Run(); err != nil {
    return fmt.Errorf("...: %w", err)
}
```

Create an `internal/cmdutil` package with helper functions:

```go
func RunCommand(name string, args ...string) error
func RunCommandInDir(dir, name string, args ...string) error
func RunCommandWithOutput(name string, args ...string) (string, error)
```

This reduces boilerplate and centralizes error handling.

**Implementation notes:**
- Search for all exec.Command patterns in the codebase
- Create internal/cmdutil/cmdutil.go with the helper functions
- Refactor existing code to use the new helpers
- Add tests for the new package

**This will require sub-tasks for each extraction.**

title: Consolidate Test Helpers
description:
**Medium Priority - Item 3 from Code Review**

Two nearly identical `initTestRepo` functions exist with different signatures:
- `cmd/giverny/test_helpers.go`: `initTestRepo(t, dir)`
- `internal/git/test_helpers.go`: `initTestRepo(t, dir, content ...string)`

Create a shared `internal/testutil` package to consolidate test utilities.

**Implementation notes:**
- Create internal/testutil/testutil.go
- Unify the initTestRepo functions with the more flexible signature (variadic content)
- Update all test files to use the shared package
- Remove the duplicate test_helpers.go files

title: Fix Silent Errors in Test Setup
description:
**Medium Priority - Item 4 from Code Review**

In `cmd/giverny/test_helpers.go` and `internal/git/test_helpers.go`, git config commands don't check for errors:

```go
// Bad - errors ignored
exec.Command("git", "-C", dir, "config", "user.email", "test@example.com").Run()

// Good - errors checked
if err := exec.Command("git", "-C", dir, "config", "user.email", "test@example.com").Run(); err != nil {
    t.Fatalf("failed to set user.email: %v", err)
}
```

**Implementation notes:**
- Find all .Run() calls in test helpers that don't check errors
- Add proper error checking with t.Fatalf()
- This could be combined with the testutil consolidation task

title: Implement PID File Polling for Git Server
description:
**Medium Priority - Item 5 from Code Review**

In `internal/git/git_server.go`, there's a TODO comment (lines 75-77) about replacing stderr pattern matching ("Ready to rumble") with PID file polling. 

This would be more robust and avoid potential issues with:
- stderr buffering
- Message format changes in future git versions

**Implementation notes:**
- Research how git daemon's --pid-file option works
- Implement polling for the PID file instead of stderr matching
- Add timeout handling
- Update tests
